meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or characteristic of an allylic compound.
meanings.sent1: The chemist studied the allylic properties of the compound.
meanings.sent2: The allylic bond in the molecule was crucial for its reactivity.
meanings.sent3: The allylic compound threw a party for all its chemical friends.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as allylic as the bond between carbon atoms.
meanings.sent5: The allylic nature of the substance made it stand out in the experiment.

meanings.sent1: The allylic side chain enhanced the compound's stability.
meanings.sent2: The molecule's allylic group contributed to its unique properties.
meanings.sent3: The allylic group always led the way in the chemical reactions.
meanings.sent4: His allylic creativity shone through in his innovative experiments.
meanings.sent5: The allylic group acted as a beacon in the sea of molecules.
